text: The Três Irmãos Dam is an embankment dam with gravity sections on the Tietê River in Pereira Barreto of São Paulo state in Brazil. The dam is about upstream of the river's confluence with the Paraná River. It supports the largest hydroelectric power station on the river with an installed capacity of . The dam was completed in 1991 and the five Francis turbine-generators were commissioned between November 1993 and January 1999. It is owned and operated by Companhia Energética de São Paulo (CESP). The dam also provides for navigation with two ship locks. ==References== ==External links== Category:Dams completed in 1991 Category:Dams in São Paulo (state) Category:Embankment dams Category:Hydroelectric power stations in Brazil Category:Locks of Brazil Category:1991 establishments in Brazil
title: Três Irmãos Dam
